parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bring up children, rear young. From a compound of teknon and trepho; to be a childrearer, i.e. Fulfil the duties of a female parent.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To entertain strangers, practice hospitality. From a compound of xenos and dechomai; to be hospitable.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To wash; mid. I wash my own (hands, etc.). To cleanse; ceremonially, to perform ablution.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To aid, relieve, do service, render help, be strong enough for. From epi and arkeo; to avail for, i.e. Help.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make narrow (strictly: by pressure); I press upon, (b) I persecute, press hard. Akin to the base of tribos; to crowd.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To follow close after, accompany, dog; I imitate, pursue, be studious of. From epi and akoloutheo; to accompany.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
